column4: MasterCard  Target data breach settlement falls apart
column5: A proposed $19 million settlement between MasterCard Inc and Target Corp over the retailer's 2013 data breach fell through after not enough banks accepted the deal  the credit card company said on Thursday.

column4: MasterCard  Target data breach settlement falls apart
column5: A proposed $19 million settlement between MasterCard Inc and Target Corp over the retailer's 2013 data breach fell through after not enough banks accepted the deal  the credit card company said on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 1-MasterCard  Target data breach settlement falls apart
column5: May 22 A proposed $19 million settlement between MasterCard Inc and Target Corp over the retailer's 2013 data breach fell through after not enough banks accepted the deal  the credit card company said on Thursday.

column4: MasterCard  Target fail to reach settlement on 2013 data breach
column5: May 22 MasterCard Inc  the world's No. 2 debit and credit card company  said it failed to reach a settlement with Target Corp over claims related to the 2013 data breach at the retailer as a key condition was not met.

column4: Telecom Italia advisers value tower unit at up to 2.4 billion euros: source
column5: MILAN The banks advising Telecom Italia on the initial public offering (IPO) of its tower unit INWIT have valued the 40 percent stake it plans to list at up to 970 million euros  a source close to the matter said.

column4: Telecom Italia advisers value tower unit at up to 2.4 bln eur-source
column5: MILAN  May 22 The banks advising Telecom Italia on the initial public offering (IPO) of its tower unit INWIT have valued the 40 percent stake it plans to list at up to 970 million euros  a source close to the matter said.

column4: THAILAND PRESS-Toyota Thai unit downbeat on auto sales forecast - Bangkok Post
column5: A Thai unit of Toyota Motor Corp conceded that local sales of its commercial and passenger vehicles would drop this year as the market struggles to recover  Bangkok Post reported  citing Toyota Motor Thailand President Kyoichi Tanada. (http://bit.ly/1AiAFGZ)

column4: Wal-Mart urges meat suppliers to curb antibiotic use
column5: CHICAGO Wal-Mart Stores Inc  is pressing meat  seafood  dairy and egg suppliers to reduce the use of antibiotics  becoming the first large retailer to take such a public stand against the excessive use of drugs in raising farm animals.

column4: UPDATE 3-Wal-Mart urges meat suppliers to curb antibiotic use
column5: CHICAGO  May 22 Wal-Mart Stores Inc is pressing meat  seafood  dairy and egg suppliers to reduce the use of antibiotics  becoming the first large retailer to take such a public stand against the excessive use of drugs in raising farm animals.

column4: Wal-Mart urges meat suppliers to curb antibiotic use
column5: CHICAGO  May 22 Wal-Mart Stores Inc is pressing meat  seafood  dairy and egg suppliers to reduce the use of antibiotics  becoming the first large retailer to take a stand against the excessive use of drugs in raising farm animals.

column4: Wal-Mart U.S. asking meat suppliers to reduce antibiotic use
column5: May 22 Wal-Mart Stores Inc said its U.S. units were asking meat suppliers to reduce the use of antibiotics in farm animals and provide annual reports on antibiotics management and animal welfare.

column4: Disney to bring mobile technology to more parks
column5: ANAHEIM  California The mobile technology that helps Walt Disney Co theme park guests beat lines and pay for Mickey Mouse ears at the company's flagship resort in Florida will expand in some form to other Disney resorts  Chief Operating Officer Tom Staggs said.

column4: UPDATE 1-Westpac eyes China  India for commodities trade growth - executive
column5: HONG KONG  May 22 A recent entrant in Asia's commodities markets  Australia's Westpac Banking Corp  is ramping up to take advantage of a commodities "supercycle" that it says has at least another 30 years to run.
